title: Convert Living Soil into No Till | How To Grow The Best Organic Weed Without Synthetic Fertilizers

tasks.task: Prepare for a no-till soil amendment method after harvest.
subtasks: Confirm readiness with essential items (bong, tea, beverages).
Present a video demonstration of converting organic living soil to no-till method.
Explain the initial soil mix (half Fox Farm Ocean Forest and Happy Frog).
Describe dry amendments and microbial life from compost.
Recommend pre-made mixes as alternatives for beginners.
Explain top dressing recipe and its components.
Address mycorrhizae disruption from tilling and benefits of cover crops.
Detail the no-till method's process and ingredient application order.
Describe the role of chitin in crab meal for pest deterrence.
Explain the benefits of langbanite in sulfur and magnesium content.
Monitor mycelium and worm activity in the amended soil.
Suggest soil testing after each cycle for fine-tuning.
Promote engagement via video interactions and click-throughs.

tasks.task: Convert 15-gallon pots to no-till method.
subtasks: Collect reamending materials and pack equipment.
Remove old roots and prepare pots for fresh soil.
Apply top dressing according to recipe (chitin, langbanite, etc.).
Integrate mycelium and ensure proper aeration.
Monitor decomposition and worm activity over weeks.
Prepare for re-planting within 2-3 weeks.

tasks.task: Adjust 5 and 10-gallon pots for no-till conversion.
subtasks: Measure and mix appropriate amounts of amendments.
Ensure proper aeration and mycorrhizae network.
Allow sufficient time for decomposition before re-planting.

tasks.task: Discuss advantages of hands-on soil management.
subtasks: Highlight the benefits of knowing ingredients sources.
Prepare for future grows with adjusted soil recipes.
Ensure adaptability to supply shortages (e.g., oyster shell vs. limestone powder).

tasks.task: Convert organic living soil to a no-till method after harvest.
